content:
I don't think you should include non-ascii characters like ’ (chr(8217)). This causes iterating over bytes to get the wrong results. Handling something like that in lower level languages like C is very annoying. Furthermore that weird case is also only found in the middle of a very long test case so it's almost impossible to spot while solving.

Also the last validator seems to be the exact same as the test case...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Short and easy-to-solve. Perfect for a fastest, shortest, reverse puzzle.

Hello. This is a quick and easy-to-solve puzzle, I would suggest some changes before it is published.

x2 represents 2, but x20 represents 32 (ASCII space). There is no need to replace all zeros with '', as there cannot be a trailing 0 before any valid character in a string. Everything below 16 is a control character. 

Please make the change, and I'll definitely approve it then. :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good and easy clash.

the supression of the zeros is confusing :
i suggest
 - to remove it
 - or add a test case to guide players
   exemple:
       - test1 : HelloWord -> x48x65x6cx6cx6fx57x6fx72x6cx64
       - test2 : P0 @ -> x5x3x2x4

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this
Good Clash, may be a little simple. Are you sure that a space is represented by x2 ? For me it's x20. Is this done on purpose or is it a mistake?  Or my mistake maybe :)
I've modified the code and test cases to take this into account. ^-^
I've modified the code and test cases to take this into account. ^-^
